Posts.Content: luvmyboy wrote: hi all,  i've been monitoring some masses in my left breast this past year with semi-annual mammo and sono, and recently decided to see a surgeon for added oversite (mom was diagnosed early). Because of the family history and my density (breast :), she recommended an MRI with and without contrasts.  She just called to say that the MRI of the left side continues to be consistent with fibroadenoma, but that the radiologist would like a mammo and sono of right breast. I haven't had one of the right side in a year, and that was my first. She sees what my surgeon called "clumped enhancement deep inside," but she also noted that it has benign kinetics.  I have read about the higher rate of false positive with MRI, or rather that it picks up other non-malignant things, but can anyone speculate what clumping might suggest?  Many thanks, and warm hugs to you all.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mri results, any experts on mri around? luvmyboy Kam28

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 06:35PM luvmyboy wrote: everyone posting here understands your anxiety. I know several others will post and tell you that the chances are still extremely high that whatever they see is benign.  I have 4 benign fibroadenomas in one breast, that caused me to have a second mammo, sono, and mri.  in the end, they decided they were all likely to be fibroadenoma, not cancerous. Of course the mri showed something in the OTHER breast that is making me worry, but my point is, there are plenty of things that show up that are not cancer.  Search on Beesie, she has great info on this.  I'm not telling you to relax, because I share the fears, but I am telling you what I have learned about the probabilities.  Hang in there.  K
Posts.Title: Pretty scared stacyRuss stacyRuss

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2009 09:47PM - edited Aug 15, 2009 09:48PM by luvmyboy sparrow, so glad you vented here!  See how many people understand and support you?  My contribution is the comment, based on personal experience, that .25 mg of Xanax might not be enough.  I have a script for .5 mg ( am about 5'4'' and weigh 138 lbs) and barely feel it.  It helps a bit, but nothing really overt.  I have only taken it a couple of times, so it isn't that i have a tolerance either.  I have been thinking of asking for ativan instead, never tried that.  I don't get panic, but I get real close.  I would imagine for true panic, like you are experiencing, you would need at least .5 mgs.  Maybe discuss with your psychiatrist?  I'm waiting for yet another diagnostic mammo and sono next wednesday, and feel like someone is stepping on my chest.  hang in there hun.
Posts.Title: I just can't deal with this Sparrow one-L

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2009 09:15PM luvmyboy wrote: thanks cbm, especially for understanding. I may just reach out to my mom's onc. he is actually her former onc, mom has since moved out of state.  I don't feel comfortable worrying her about this yet. she is dealing with pretty extensive mets herself right now, and I don't know how she will take it if I am diagnosed.  So, while she probably has the best advice for me, i don't feel like I can tell her yet.  She is pretty fragile these days.  Again, thanks for your response and encouragement!  I hope all is going well for you right now.   K

Posts.Content: luvmyboy wrote: I've been told by a physican friend that sometimes biopsy samples are sent to be looked at by another pathologist for a second opinion.  Can anyone tell me, are our biopsy samples kept for a certain amount of time in case our surgeon or primary wants to do this?  Or do you need to request that they are kept, in case you want a path second opinion?  I am having a core needle biopsy on Friday, and just want to have that option remain open... Anyone know how second opinions work for pathology?   Thanks! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2009 07:15PM luvmyboy wrote: Jenny-Ann,  I felt comforted today knowing that there was someone who was on the same time-line and also so very anxious.  I'm sorry that you got more worried today, but glad that you will know something tomorrow as well!  How old are you, if I may ask?  I am 40.  My son is six.  All my fears center around him. I panic to think about the implications of cancer on him.  Today was particularly tough with those thoughts.  Common to so many of us, I know.  One more day to get through. Of course, they will probably order a biopsy next and the waiting game will continue.  At that point, i'm getting some xanax! K  ps, do you know how to post privately?  I am new to this board and can't figure it out.
Posts.Title: what are the first steps? luvmyboy jenny_ann

Posts.Content: luvmyboy wrote: hi all,  I had an MRI last week to look further at a suspicious area of my left breast, and while that came back negative, there was concern about my RIGHT breast, clumped enhancements.  I have a new mammo and US scheduled for next wednesday, at the recommendation of my breast surgeon and the diagnostic radiologist. It has been a year since that side was mammo'd.  I'm the kind of person who will go nuts if I don't have a plan.  Making my plan makes me calmer.  Can anyone tell me what my first steps should be?  Right now, I have the breast surgeon following me, and a new GYN. They are from a local group, not a big breast center.  Should I be pursuing setting up a second opinion somewhere?  Sloan Kettering is close by.  Should I be trying to line up an oncologist or is that premature?  My mother had breast cancer and I know her oncologist...  Who makes the recommendations regarding your overall plan, an oncologist or a surgeon?  Am I totally nuts to be thinking about this at this point?   thanks for any advice! Log in to post a reply
